Windows XP support coming to an end , what is meant ?
In the past 12 years , Microsoft has been providing support services to Windows XP. But now we are well on our hardware and software suppliers, it is time to shift our resources to support more the latest technology so that we can continue to provide users with an excellent new experience.

Thus, after April 8, 2014 , we no longer offer Windows XP technical assistance , including help protect your computer automatically updated. After this date, Microsoft will stop providing services to download Microsoft Security Essentials Windows XP. ( If you have already installed Microsoft Security Essentials, you will continue to receive a limited period of time anti-malware signature updates , but that does not mean that your computer is safe and reliable , because Microsoft will no longer provide security to protect your computer updated. )

If you continue to use Windows XP after support ends , then your computer may still work, but it may be more vulnerable to security risks and viruses. In addition, because more software and hardware manufacturers to improve their products more compatible with the latest version of Windows, therefore , a large number of applications and devices will not work in Windows XP.
